definition: to have an undeserved reputation (idiom)
wave/breaker/unrestrained/dissipated/to stroll/to ramble
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: This small"demon"not wave get hollow reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这个小“精灵”绝非浪得虚名。

sentences.english: Reputationisoften got without merit and lost without fault .
sentences.chinese: 浪得虚名寻常见，无过失名亦不鲜。

definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
first under heaven/number one in the country
name/good reputation/title
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
absolutely not
fame follows merit (idiom)
ability/skill
to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
famous/celebrated
